intro: Calotheca littoralis, commonly known as the coastal green alga, is a marine species belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It reproduces through both sexual and asexual means, producing zoospores that develop into new gametophytes. Calotheca littoralis plays an important role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
